definitions.definition: devote time and attention to acquiring knowledge on (an academic subject), especially by means of books.
investigate and analyze (a subject or situation) in detail.
examples: he has been studying mink for many years
synonyms: conduct a survey of "Thomas was studying child development"

examples: he spent his time listening to the radio rather than studying

definitions.definition: acquire academic knowledge at an educational establishment.
examples: he studied at the Kensington School of Art

definitions.definition: learn intensively about something, especially in preparation for a test of knowledge.
examples: a graduate student studies up for her doctoral exams

definitions.definition: (of an actor) try to learn (the words of one's role).
give serious thought or consideration to.
examples: the people here don't make so much noise, so you will find that the government doesn't have us to study

definitions.definition: look at closely in order to observe or read.
examples: she bent her head to study the plans

definitions.definition: make an effort to achieve (a result) or take into account (a person or their wishes).
examples: with no husband to study, housekeeping is mere play
